name: The 1936 Congress of the Trade Unions
description: This year's TUC will probably be a bit special - long-time Chairman Philip Snowden has indicated that he intends to resign. The decentralisationist Autonomists, led by Niclas y Glais, centralisationist Maximists (Oswald Mosley) and status quo Federationists (Arthur Horner) with his egalitarian & pacifist running mate Sylvia Pankhurst are all vying for superiority. These will be nights to remember...

name: Home Rule
description: Syndicalism has to be achieved locally. Some offices, like tax enforcers - nobody likes those people anyway - can be moved to the home nation capitals of Cardiff and Edinburgh. They can prepare the establishment of local TUCs.

name: Dissolve the TUC
description: The Trade Union Congress has served its purpose. While it once represented the Syndicalist dream of true proletarian government, it now symbolises Centralist repression to many. With the success of our initial decentralisation efforts, the time has come to make the People's Palace the seat of a new, English TUC. The remains of the Union will be dealt with shortly.

name: Move the TUC
description: London has long held a privileged place in Britain, and has become swamped by Centralism and bureaucracy; the TUC's current location reinforces this. Only by moving to a smaller city, one at the heart of Britain, and thus within reach of all its people, will we able to guarantee fair representation for all. This city will be Birmingham.

name: Devolution
description: With the establishment of TUCs in Cardiff and Edinburgh, the process of Devolution will come to a successful end.

name: Three Armies
description: Now that the home countries have at least partly gained their autonomy that same autonomy should go to the Worker's Militias. While we will initially have to help out with the establishment of new structures the new militaries should be able to stand on their own soon enough.

name: Embrace the Status Quo
description: The syndicalist order has withstood an onslaught of political challenges, but has held firm. Britain shall keep its course, and continue to boldly and unapologetically champion the cause of the worker and the revolution above all else.

name: Evolution
description: Both the Autonomists and the Maximists are trying to change an already working machine. British Syndicalism is fine as it is; If only they would understand that...

name: Political Commissars
description: Sometimes, even the most diligent Syndicalist needs a small reminder of his duties. Sometimes, that reminder should be given from behind a revolvers' sights.

name: United Britain
description: Britain faces great adversity both within and without. While conflict with reactionary nations may prove unavoidable, surely our nation and its people should stand united. Enemies of the revolution must be confronted and eliminated by any means necessary.

name: The Grand Protector
description: While it is unconstitutional, unifying the offices of General Secretary and Chairman of the Trade Union Congress in the new office of Grand Protector of the Union of Britain will give us much more power to push through our reforms.

name: Revolution
description: This whole 'reforming the country' business has turned out to be very boring. We can attempt one swift strike to totally seize the means of politics and make our political programme a reality. This will be risky, though.

name: Another Congress of the Trade Unions
description: The world has changed in the last few years, and now would be a perfect opportunity to review our leaders. The Chairman has calls for elections in all major posts, including his own.

name: The State of the Economy
description: Our economy was enlarged in the time leading up to the war. The extraordinary congress now has to face the decision of either pushing for further expansion or prioritising the healing of the wounds inflicted by the war.

name: Cut Out Red Tape
description: Fighting a war often allows for some more unsavoury elements of the bureaucracy to carve out their own little empires while the government is embroiled in defending the homeland. We need to overcome these war profiteers with all due haste.

name: Demobilisation Programme
description: Fighting the war was hard; Living peace will be even harder. A programme to ensure a regulated turn to peace production is in order.

name: The Common Land
description: While Britain was the birthplace of the industrial revolution, much of our nation remains rural and reliant on agriculture. To facilitate increased crop yields, all lands seized from noble estates during the revolution should be parceled to rural syndicates. Britain's land shall now belong to her people alone!

name: Local Talent Initiative
description: We cannot afford to waste innovative talent just because it is not centred in the metropolitan areas. We need to support local talent.

name: Local Help Initiative
description: Many Comrades in the Union of Britain are still living in great poverty. The bureaucracy has done little to help them. If we extended our support of the local councils, these suffering people would finally feel the blessings of the revolution.

name: Expand Local Initiative
description: While we have granted much power to the local communes, they continue to deal primarily with the central government. We should make reaching the central government harder so that our workers will work with each other for true socialist progress.

name: Central Industry Research
description: To prepare our Syndicalist industry for the fight against the Capitalists, we should establish the Department for Central Industry Research. This office will help us overcome inefficiency.

name: Militarised Industry
description: Only through relentless efficiency and discipline, even in the most mundane of tasks, will we be able to beat the capitalists.

name: Mobilised Industry
description: We need to convert every single Industrial complex to produce material valuable to the war effort.

name: Industrial Veteran Programme
description: Promoting practical experience in the factories will lead to a further increase in efficiency.

name: Expand Industry: Wales and the Midlands
description: The capitalist regime of old neglected Wales and the Midlands for centuries, and allowed, if not outright encouraged, the gradual depopulation of the region as its labourers migrated to England's southern cities for menial jobs. The great economic potential of these regions and its people thus remains largely untapped; for the benefit of all, we must invest!

name: Expand Industry: Scotland
description: Scotland to has been left behind, had its people neglected and its wealth stolen by the capitalist pigs. No more; today investment will flow north!

name: Military Industry: Southern England
description: While the south hasn't been neglected to the same degree as other regions, its workers will still under invested in. By investing in the area and expanding the talent of the great syndicalist workers there will be able to grow military industry rapidly.

name: Military Industry: Northern England
description: It is time to make the North of England a great 'Northern Powerhouse'! With enough investment it will soon be creating arms to support those fighting for workers the world over.

name: The British Rail Reform
description: The British Rail Syndicate is in a horrid state. By investing into our infrastructure, we will assure flawless cooperation between Syndicates all over the island.

name: A New Lee Enfield?
description: The rifles supplied by the factories formerly owned by Lee Enfield still constitute the overwhelming majority of our infantry weapons. However, at least according to gun connoisseurs, the weapons produced by the Birmingham Small Arms Factory have the reputation of being more suitable for offensive manoeuvres and change might be in order.

name: Vote for Officers
description: One of the central achievements of Syndicalism is the end of the tyrannical rule of the officers in our armed forces.

name: People's Officer Corps
description: Officers have a duty, and that is to be loyal to the revolution. By establishing a centralised People's Officer Corps and ending the terrible practice of military units voting for their own leaders, we can make sure they fulfil that duty.

name: Decentralised Command
description: While our armies are decentralised, they still rely on inefficient chains of command to make tactical decisions. Non-commissioned officers and even the humblest of militiamen must be instilled with the spirit of leadership and given the agency to direct their units as they see fit. No man should die waiting for an order to be issued.

name: Central Command
description: We need to establish a central Army Headquarters to optimise communication and cooperation between army units. This will allow for more grand-scale operations to be planned in an efficient manner.

name: Reform the Militias
description: The Worker's Militias have been reformed into something a little more usable while the old democratic structures have been preserved. They still somewhat hinder military efficiency - but that we are able to tolerate. Break the Chains!

name: Dissolve the Militias
description: The arms in the hands of the rabble have been tolerated for too long now. While our enemies hold on to these remains of a bygone age for some reason we know that only discipline is the way forward.

name: The R.E.D.
description: With the establishment of the Revolutionary Exportation Directory we will finally be able to conduct clandestine operations to help the workers around the world in their struggle against their oppressors!

name: Improve the Army: The Lewis M1936
description: The equipment of the soldiers of the Revolution can never be perfect enough - time to improve upon our tried and tested design for a mainline machine gun!

name: Artillery Integration Research
description: A Focus on artillery research will lead to improved integration into our combat units. This is, apparently, a good thing.

name: Adopt New Doctrines
description: Now that the military order has been changed, we need to optimise the organisation of logistics, messages and orders, all that small, boring stuff that wins wars.

name: Motorised Research
description: While tanks are good and all somehow it seems they become even more useful when the infantry can actually keep up with them. Maybe we should investigate this circumstance.

name: Tank Research
description: Innovations in Tank Design will make our forces both more manoeuvrable as well as more durable. What's not to love?

name: Women Soldiers
description: The equality of all comrades is necessary for the victory of the Revolution. It is unacceptable that, right now, some are 'more equal' than others.

name: Revolutionary Admiralty
description: The Office of the Admiralty and Marine Affairs was the body responsible for the administration of the Royal Navy and served as a forum for communication between officers. The Republican Navy currently lacks any comparable office, with Naval affairs often tied-up in politics. Thus, we must establish an independent and thoroughly socialist Admiralty.

name: Cayley's Plan
description: During the Weltkrieg, the Germans used U-Boats to great effect. Admiral Richard Cayley is at the forefront of a highly vocal group of naval officers who wish to see Britain rapidly expand its submarine fleet and restructure its doctrine with Germany as its model.

name: Submarine Effort
description: Per Admiral Cayley's direction, our presently quite small submarine fleet is due for expansion. Our current submarine designs, however, are inadequate. We must develop and deploy more advanced models.

name: Destroyer Effort
description: Our new fleet cannot operate entirely below the waves. To support out U-Boats, we need ships that are both versatile and agile, capable of dealing with those threats are U-Boats are unable to.

name: Anstice's Plan
description: While many scoff at the notion that aircraft could ever serve as the backbone of a navy, Admiral Edmund Anstice asserts the necessity of controlling the skies over the sea. To do so, Anstice proposes that the role and number of aircraft carriers be greatly expanded.

name: Carrier Effort
description: Aircraft Carriers have taken on a much greater role in naval combat, and Britain must change with the times. Our carrier fleet will be the centrepiece of the renewed British Navy.

name: Naval Aviation
description: Traditional aircraft designs are unable to fulfil the unique requirements of naval aviation. We must develop new aircraft designed be operated from carriers and other situations where runway space is at a premium.

name: Warburton-Lee's Plan
description: The Royal Navy was centred around the battleship and naval firepower. While Britain lost the Weltkrieg, its Navy held strong throughout the conflict. Since the revolution, naval strategy has advanced rapidly, and to many Republican naval officers, the Union of Britain must make a concerted effort to catch up to its rivals, rather than take a radical new approach to naval warfare.

name: Battleship Effort
description: While lacking the armour of a Dreadnought, Battleships are agile and pack a versatile suite of heavy guns. An evolution of the Battlecruisers of WW1 who served effectively during the Weltkrieg, an expansion of our Battleship fleets is essential to the reconstruction of the British Navy.

name: Dreadnought Effort
description: Dreadnoughts are the kings of the sea, and were key to the global dominance of the British Royal Navy at the prior to the Weltkrieg. If we are to ever regain our naval strength, we must have new battleships.

name: Merchant Marine
description: The British Merchant Service was on the bleeding edge of civilian shipping administration. During the Weltkrieg, tactics developed by the Service to counter U-Boat raids kept Britain from terrible starvation. If our republic is to have any chance of surviving future conflicts, we must develop a robust Merchant Marine to both regulate shipping and conscript civilian ships for military service when needed.

name: Expand Dockyards
description: With a Merchant Marine service established and all union operated ships firmly integrated, our nation's ports are becoming increasingly congested. With the problem projected to only worsen, we must immediately expand the most clogged ports.

name: Republican Marines
description: While naval power and the projection thereof are critical to military success, ships alone are unable to invade islands or assault coasts. Few Marine officers sided with the revolution in 1925, and as a result, the Republic's ability to conduct amphibious operations was stunted. If we are to having any hope of confronting our enemies across the seas, we must have a Marine department.

name: Britannia Rules the Waves
description: At last, the British Navy is beginning to look like its former self. If not already, soon enough, Britain will again rule the waves! Britons never will be slaves!

name: Republican Air Force
description: Air power is critical for success on the modern battlefield. Currently, our air service is subordinate to our army, and while that assures democratisation, an independent Air Force would certainly be more effective. Thus, we must establish an Air Force both independent and socialist in character.

name: Light Bomber Research
description: While control of the skies is essential, what good is an air force if it does not assist the men on the ground? Light bombers, both specialized for direct support and destruction of hard targets, will allow our troops to fight that much more effectively.

name: Fighter Research
description: The enemy may focus on bomber research - but what good are improved payloads if they only hit the ground together with their burning bomber?

name: New Pilot Training
description: Pilot training in many nations, including our own, has been largely non-standard, and reliant on enthusiasts turned instructors. By consulting with prominent pilots, we can develop an effective training regimen.

name: Aviation Unions
description: Many syndicates around Britain operate small aerodromes for a variety of purposes. The larger of these facilities should be given state funding for expansion.

name: Expand Air Unions
description: Our programme of aerodrome enlargement was of great benefit to the expansion of the Republican Air Force, but proved to be a substantial administrative burden. With the air force now well-established, the Air Union programme can be expanded.

name: Aviation Fuel Administration
description: Without fuel, it does not matter how skilled our pilots are. It is likely that when war comes our fuel imports will be cut-off so we must work towards domestics sources of fuel; for the safety of the revolution we mustn't be depended on capitalist suppliers of oil. They can't be trusted.

name: Controlling the Skies
description: For thousands of years, Britain could rely on the Sea to keep it safe from any invaders. For the first time we have to confront the real possibility of an airborne invasion. But we can rely on a doctrine well-tested: simply build as many as the next two together. More Fighters! More Bombers!

name: Women's Flying Corps
description: Capable pilots are always in short supply, and the women of our nation, whose support was so crucial to the success of the revolution, yearn for the freedom of the skies. While it will certainly prove controversial, we have drafted a plan to create allow women to serve in the RAF in support roles to free up more men for combat.

name: Air Observer Corps
description: While London was terrorised throughout the Weltkrieg by German airships, relatively little damage was done by these raids. Since then however, the range and payload of aircraft has increased greatly. To counter the threat, we should create a volunteer organisation which looks vigilantly for enemy planes to forewarn our interceptor and anti-aircraft teams.

name: R.A.D.A.R.
description: A new technology by the name of R.A.D.A.R. could help us avoid suffering what we want to inflict on our enemies.

name: Britain Within the International
description: Britain's political factions advocate quite different foreign policy approaches. With the turbulent 1936 special session of the TUC at an end, Britain's place in the world, and especially its relationship with its socialist comrades of the Third Internationale, must be reassessed.

name: Show of Force
description: With the newest aircraft carrier RNS Rebecca fully operational the Republican Navy was ready to reclaim her rightful position among the mightiest navies of the world. However, the target of her first action is heavily disputed.

name: Words
description: While the Irish aren't our closest friends, to invade now would be to repeat the mistakes and atrocities of the very empire we fought against. Diplomacy will resolve the current Irish situation!

name: War
description: The Irish worker, much like the English worker, has suffered enough. Revolution has not yet, however, engulfed Ireland, and so war is needed to resolve the current Irish situation!

name: Anglo-Irish Friendship
description: With the light of socialism at last shining upon the Emerald Isle, the time for reconciliation between our historically closely linked peoples has come. Not only should we send diplomats and politicians to Dublin, but also representatives of the most successful British syndicates to help Ireland along the path of progress.

name: Class Warfare
description: War is upon us, and to preserve our great nation and secure our liberty, all working men must now unite for victory. We should promote the spirit of unity, self-sacrifice, and most of all, renewed class consciousness, to augment our war effort.

name: Blood, Toil, Tears and Sweat
description: Never was so much owed by so many to so few. The inspiring actions of our forces will help hold the Union together.

name: Victory at the Home Front
description: We beat the capitalists in the factories. Who would have thought?

name: Total Mobilisation
description: Every person in Britain will have to work for the Union. Every second of work for the Union will have to serve the war effort. Every second of the war effort will have to serve the final and absolute defeat of Capitalism.

name: Fortress Britain
description: There will be no second Peace with Honour - we will stand to the last soldier. We shall fight on the beaches...

name: Bletchley Park
description: In the north of Buckinghamshire, a crack team of military intelligence researchers has emerged. Despite minimal funding, the Bletchley Park Electrician's Union, in coordination with our foreign intelligence service, has produced singular results. We should expand Bletchley Park's facilities and provide them with substantial state funding.

name: Damocles Project
description: We shall base this new 'research centre' in Manchester. This large centre of industry will provide ample workers for construction and its central localisation will make it easier to move resources there.

name: Statistical Warfare
description: This war will be won on the tables and chalkboards of the mathematicians and researchers. We have to set our priorities accordingly.

name: Support Foreign Comrades
description: If socialism is to survive, all socialist nations must thrive. It is our duty as socialists to assist the formerly downtrodden peoples around the globe who now valiantly rise up against their oppressors.

name: Mission to Norway
description: Norway is rife for Syndicalism. We could send a team of politically experienced advisers and leaders to the Norwegian Syndicalist Party, bringing pressure on the capitalists and supporting the Syndicalists.

name: Norwegian Comrades
description: A more equitable Norway has arisen, and we will stand arm in arm with our socialist brethren there. The Norwegian and British people have much to offer each other, and as a gesture of our goodwill, we shall offer Norway generous economic assistance in exchange simply for future cooperation.

name: American Comrades
description: From America's manufacturing belt has come forth a redoubt of socialism. This new bastion of liberation, however, could easily be destroyed by the reactionaries it defies. We must assist the courageous workers of America any way that we can.

name: Mexican Comrades
description: The people of Mexico were among the first to cast off the chains of capitalist exploitation. Mexico remains, however, quite underdeveloped. We possess the means to help the Mexicans better their lot, and such assistance would surely foster closer ties between our nations.

name: Indian Comrades
description: Britain was once the oppressor of the Indian people. However, the strength of the relationship between our two peoples, regardless of the unfortunate circumstance in which it was built, is undeniable. Through economic assistance to Bharatiya Commune, we can begin to put right the injustices of history, and in the process, strengthen the socialist cause.

name: Mission to Australasia
description: Socialism down-under is in dire straits. If our comrades are to fight capitalist tyranny successfully, they must have assistance.

name: Australasian Comrades
description: Now that socialism down-under has stabilised, we much give them what support we can to avoid them slipping back into their old ways.

name: Further Cooperation
description: We must do even more assist our North American allies. The relationship we are building there will surely be the start of something far greater.

name: Liberation of Canada
description: Across the Atlantic Ocean in the frigid north, the devil himself seemingly lies in wait. Canada and its lackeys will surely strike us with even the smallest opportunity. We cannot wait to be attacked; we are as ready now to liberate the people of Canada as we ever will be.
